net.sf.freecol.common.model.mission

Interface Mission

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMission, CompoundMission, GoToMission, ImprovementMission

    public interface Mission
    The Mission interface describes some kind of order that can be given to a Unit, such as the order to move to a certain Tile, attack a certain Unit, or build a TileImprovement, for example. Missions can be atomic, or combine a number of simpler Missions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Mission.MissionState 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Mission.MissionState doMission()
      Attempts to carry out the mission and returns an appropriate MissionState.
      Unit getUnit()
      Return the Unit this mission was assigned to.
      boolean isValid()
      Returns true if the mission is still valid.
      void toXML(FreeColXMLWriter xw)
      This method writes an XML-representation of this object to the given stream.

    • Method Detail

      • doMission

        Mission.MissionState doMission()
        Attempts to carry out the mission and returns an appropriate MissionState.
        Returns:
        a MissionState value

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Returns true if the mission is still valid. This might not be the case if its target or destination have been destroyed, or if the Unit this mission was assigned to was destroyed or changed owner, for example.
        Returns:
        a boolean value

      • getUnit

        Unit getUnit()
        Return the Unit this mission was assigned to.
        Returns:
        an Unit value

      • toXML

        void toXML(FreeColXMLWriter xw)
    throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        This method writes an XML-representation of this object to the given stream.
        Parameters:
        xw - The FreeColXMLWriter to write to.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - if there are any problems writing to the stream.
